meanings.definition: One that causes or produces an effect or result.
meanings.sent1: The causer of the loud noise was a falling book.
meanings.sent2: The car engine was the causer of the strange sound.
meanings.sent3: The causer of the chaos in the kitchen was a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter was the causer of smiles all around.
meanings.sent5: The causer of the problem was a leaky faucet that went unnoticed.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that acts or brings about a particular result or event.
meanings.sent1: The causer of the celebration was the surprise party thrown by her friends.
meanings.sent2: The weather was the causer of the canceled picnic.
meanings.sent3: The causer of the laughter at the party was a funny joke told by the host.
meanings.sent4: His absence was the causer of concern among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The causer of the traffic jam was a broken traffic light at the intersection.
